problem_text:
If G is a (non-abelian) finite group contained in a join A ∨ B of two varieties A, B of groups, must there exist finite groups A ∈ A, B ∈ B such that G is a section of the direct product A × B?
L. G. Kov´acs
answer: Not always (A. Storozhev, Bull. Austral. Math. Soc., 51, no. 2 (1995), 287–290).
